skill.name: github-release-management
skill.description: Comprehensive GitHub release orchestration with AI swarm coordination for automated versioning, testing, deployment, and rollback management
skill.summary: Comprehensive GitHub release orchestration with AI swarm coordination for automated versioning, test...
skill.author: Claude Flow Team

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Relies on external CLI tools (gh, npm, claude-flow) following standard secure CI/CD practices.

content.user_title: Automate GitHub releases with AI coordination
content.value_statement: Managing software releases manually is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill orchestrates the entire release lifecycle from versioning to deployment using AI swarm coordination, ensuring consistent and reliable software delivery.
actual_capabilities: Automatic semantic versioning based on commit analysis
AI-powered changelog generation from commits and PRs
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI and claude-flow installation
Cannot modify repository settings without appropriate permissions
Hotfix deployment requires pre-configured approval workflows

use_cases.title: Streamline release pipelines
use_cases.description: Automate versioning, testing, and deployment across multiple platforms with AI coordination

use_cases.title: Consistent release process
use_cases.description: Generate changelogs, publish packages, and create releases automatically from tagged commits

use_cases.title: Controlled production deployments
use_cases.description: Execute staged rollouts with monitoring and automatic rollback on failure

prompt_templates.title: Create release from tag
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a release for version {version} from the current main branch. Generate changelog, run tests, and create a GitHub release draft.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-package release
prompt_templates.prompt: Prepare a coordinated release for all packages in the monorepo. Analyze commits, bump versions consistently, and create a unified changelog.

prompt_templates.title: Staged deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy version {version} with progressive rollout. Start with 5 percent canary, monitor metrics, and auto-advance if health checks pass.

prompt_templates.title: Emergency hotfix
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute emergency hotfix for issue number {issue}. Create hotfix branch, cherry-pick commits, run critical tests, and deploy immediately with notification.

output_examples.input: Create a v2.0.0 release with changelog from v1.9.0
output: Version bump: major (3 breaking changes detected)
Changelog: 12 features, 8 fixes, 3 breaking changes, 5 docs updates
Build: linux/amd64, macos/arm64, windows/x64 artifacts generated

best_practices: Use semantic versioning and document breaking changes clearly
Always run security scans before releasing to production
Implement automated rollback triggers based on error rates and latency thresholds
anti_patterns: Releasing without changelog or release notes
Skipping testing phases for faster deployments
Deploying major changes without monitoring or rollback plan

faq.question: Which AI platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through claude-flow integration.

faq.question: How many targets can I deploy to simultaneously?
faq.answer: Supports unlimited parallel targets including npm, Docker, GitHub releases, S3, and custom endpoints.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with existing CI/CD tools?
faq.answer: Yes, provides GitHub Actions workflow templates and integrates with any CI/CD system via CLI.

faq.question: Is my code and data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. No code leaves your environment. All operations use authenticated GitHub API calls with your credentials.

faq.question: Why did my release build fail?
faq.answer: Common causes: dependency issues, test failures, or permission errors. Run diagnostic commands to identify specific issues.

faq.question: How is this different from manual gh release create?
faq.answer: Adds AI coordination for versioning analysis, changelog generation, multi-platform builds, testing, and automated rollback.
